articles.author: Gram Slattery, Pesha Magid, Andrew Mills
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump was set to meet Syria's president in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday following a surprise announcement that the United States would lift all sanctions on the Islamist-led government despite lingering concerns about its leaders' former ties to Al Qaeda.
articles.title: Trump to meet Syrian president in Saudi before heading to Qatar

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli military strikes killed at least 50 Palestinians across the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, local health authorities said, in a significant escalation of the bombardment as U.S. President Donald Trump continued his visit to the Middle East.
articles.title: Israeli intensifies Gaza bombardment as Trump visits region

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. and European diplomats went on a flurry of calls in the hours after U.S. President Donald Trump offered on Monday to join prospective Ukraine-Russia talks later this week, trying to find a path that would bring an end to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Rush of diplomatic calls follow Trump's offer to join potential Russia-Ukraine talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pakistan has received the second tranche of special drawing rights worth 760 million ($1,023 million) from the International Monetary Fund under the extended fund facility programme, the country's central bank said in a post on X on Wednesday.
articles.title: Pakistan receives second tranche under extended fund facility from IMF, cenbank says

articles.author: Sarah Young
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has criticised Britain's invitation to Donald Trump for a second state visit, saying it undermined his government's effort to project a united front against the U.S. president's talk of annexing Canada.
articles.title: Canadian PM criticises UK's invite to Trump for state visit

articles.author: Tom Perry, Timour Azhari
articles.description: The meeting with the U.S. president is a huge boost for Ahmed al-Sharaa.
articles.title: Syrian leader Sharaa's path from global jihad to Trump meeting

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Leo XIV, the first American to head the global Catholic Church, pledged on Wednesday to make "every effort" for peace and offered the Vatican as a mediator in global conflicts, saying war was "never inevitable".
articles.title: Pope Leo says he will make 'every effort' for world peace

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: The head of Russia's only independent election watchdog was sentenced on Wednesday to five years in a penal colony after being found guilty of working with an "undesirable organisation".
articles.title: Russia jails head of independent election watchdog for five years

articles.author: Julia Payne, John Irish
articles.description: The European Union must focus on a new sanctions package to suffocate Russia's economy and force President Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine, France's foreign minister said.
articles.title: Time to suffocate Russia's economy after 17th EU sanctions package, France says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Here is a timeline chronicling Libya's years of chaos and division:
articles.title: Libya's crisis: A timeline of events since the 2011 uprising
